text:
EFL Chu-Bru Reunion Arsenal transfer news: Chuba Akpom wanted by Aston Villa for Steve Bruce reunion in the Championship this month 
Forward spent last season under Bruce at Hull as Villa boss searches for firepower following failed Jordan Rhodes bid By ANTHONY CHAPMAN Comments ASTON VILLA are reportedly plotting a loan move for Arsenal striker Chuba Akpom. 
The 21-year-old played for Steve Bruce at Hull last season and the pair could now be set for a reunion in the Championship. Getty Images 5 Chuba Akpom is a January loan target for Aston Villa boss Steve Bruce 
Akpom made 42 appearances during his time at the KC Stadium and was expected to play a back-up role upon his return to north London. Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But the versatile forward is yet to feature under Arsene Wenger after picking up an injury and will now be allowed to leave to regain match fitness. 
The Birmingham Mail claims Villa have turned their attention to Akpom after failing with a £6million bid for Middlesbrough striker Jordan Rhodes. Getty Images The striker has failed to make an appearance for Arsenal this season due to an injury Granit Xhaka holds up traffic as he signs autographs for excited Arsenal fans Reuters 5 Steve Bruce played Akpom 42 times last season while at Hull 
But the ex-Brentford and Coventry City loanee is wanted by a number of other teams and will take his time to consider all options before the transfer window slams shut. 
It’s already been a busy transfer window for Bruce and Villa, with Nottingham Forest captain Henri Lansbury arriving earlier in the month for almost £3m.
